alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 10:10AM MST until February 21 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches at lower elevations, with 4 to 8 inches in the mountains and over Marias Pass. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Severe to extreme conditions are expected for newborn livestock. Dangerous wind chills may cause frostbite in less than 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
